div.p: STIGMATA, in natural hiſtory, the apertures in different parts of the bodies of infects communicating with the tracheæ or air-veſſels, and ſerving for the office of reſpiration.
Stigmata, in antiquity, certain marks impressed on the left ſhoulders of the ſoldiers when lifted.
Stigmata, were alſo a kind of notes or abbreviations, conſiſting only of points, diſpoſed various ways; as in triangles, ſquares, croſſes, &c.

Stigmata, is alſo a term introduced by the Franciſcans, to expreſs the marks or prints of our Saviour’s wounds, ſaid to have been miraculouſly impreſſed by him on the body of their ſeraphic father St Francis.
